revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins and Vertical Tectonics
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of passive continental margins and the vertical tectonics associated with rifting and spreading. It highlights the long history of subsidence in these margins, which are often linked to areas prone to subsidence as far back as the Lower Palaeozoic. The article also explores the Permian and Mesozoic rifting periods, the eustatic sea level changes, and the worldwide termination of the rift phase in the middle Cretaceous.
